title: EM induction - rod on rails with speed doubled

content.description: A conducting rod of resistance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> is in electrical contact with a <math alttext="U" overflow="scroll"> <mtext>U</mtext> </math>-shaped rail of width <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> and negligible resistance. The rod is pulled to the right at a constant speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>. A magnetic field <math alttext="vector B" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>â†’</mo></mover></math> is directed into the page, as shown. The electric power dissipated by the rod is <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math>.
content.question: What would the power dissipated by the rod be if the velocity of the rod were doubled?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
